definition: physically and forcibly separated into pieces or cracked or split
details:
adjective
- physically and forcibly separated into pieces or cracked or split

- having been violated or disregarded, especially of promises or contracts
= example: having been violated or disregarded, especially of promises or contracts
= synonyms: unkept
- not continuous in space, time, or sequence or varying abruptly
= example: not continuous in space, time, or sequence or varying abruptly
- lacking a part or parts
= example: lacking a part or parts
- out of working order
= example: out of working order
= synonyms: busted
- destroyed financially
= example: destroyed financially
= synonyms: wiped out, impoverished
- weakened and infirm
= example: weakened and infirm
- thrown into a state of disarray or confusion
= example: thrown into a state of disarray or confusion
= synonyms: confused
- imperfectly spoken or written
= example: imperfectly spoken or written
- subdued or brought low in condition or status
= example: subdued or brought low in condition or status

- topographically very uneven
= example: topographically very uneven

- tamed or trained to obey
